results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Academic Freedom;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Katz, Joshua T (1969- );Princeton University
results.title: Princeton Fires Tenured Professor in Campus Controversy
results.abstract: Joshua Katz’s dismissal is related to his inappropriate conduct with a female student, the university said. He says criticism of a campus protest group is the issue.

media.caption: Joshua Katz, a classics professor, had been suspended in 2018 for a consensual sexual relationship with a student. But the university now says he was not fully honest and cooperative with that investigation.

results.byline: By Josh Katz and Wilson Andrews
results.title: How Y’all, Youse and You Guys Talk
results.abstract: What does the way you speak say about where you’re from? Answer all the questions below to see your personal dialect map.

results.byline: By Chelsia Rose Marcius and Ali Watkins
results.title: The Suspect in a Fatal Subway Shooting Is in Police Custody
results.abstract: Andrew Abdullah was the subject of a manhunt that began minutes after a gunman shot a passenger on a northbound Q train on Sunday.

media.caption: The shooting happened as the Q train was headed to the Canal Street station in Lower Manhattan.
media.copyright: Dakota Santiago for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Primaries and Caucuses;Perdue, David A Jr;Abrams, Stacey Y;Georgia
results.title: David Perdue makes racist remarks about Stacey Abrams as he ends a lackluster campaign.
results.abstract: Mr. Perdue, who badly trails Gov. Brian Kemp in the Republican primary for governor, accused Ms. Abrams of “demeaning her own race” in describing the state’s problems.

media.caption: Former Senator David Perdue, left, speaking in Dunwoody, Ga., on Monday alongside Peter Navarro, center, a former economic adviser to Donald J. Trump, and John Fredericks, a conservative radio host.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: The Branded Marriage of Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker
results.abstract: The latest wedding in the family became a walking ad for Dolce & Gabbana. Is this a new model for celebrity matrimony?

media.caption: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker after their wedding ceremony in Portofino. They both wore Dolce & Gabbana: she in a corseted mini (accented with tulle gloves) and he in a tuxedo (with a golden cross brooch).

results.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Ivor Prickett
results.title: Powerful American Artillery Enters the Fight in Ukraine
results.abstract: The most lethal weapons the West has provided so far to Ukraine are now deployed in combat. Will they make a critical difference for Ukraine’s military in a war that has mostly become an artillery battle?

media.caption: A gun crew of the 55th Separate Artillery Brigade of Ukraine’s Armed Forces, fired a Howitzer M777 155mm artillery piece towards Russian positions in the Donetsk region of Ukraine.
media.copyright: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.title: Southern Baptist Sex Abuse Report Stuns, From Pulpit to Pews
results.abstract: The results of a sprawling investigation are coursing through every level of Baptist society, at an already fraught moment for the nation’s largest Protestant denomination.

results.title: Biden Veers Off Script on Taiwan. It’s Not the First Time.
results.abstract: Offhand remarks that vary from the official talking points have become a feature of the Biden presidency, even as they leave his staff scrambling to spin them away afterward.

results.title: As Monkeypox Cases Rise, Nations Are Urged to Examine Vaccine Stores
results.abstract: The United States has stockpiled millions of doses of two smallpox vaccines, also effective against monkeypox. But the outbreaks so far are clustered in other countries.

European Center for Disease Prevention and Control

results.abstract: The coordinated bomber flights were the first training activity the two nations had done together since President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Bondarev, Boris;Russia;Ukraine
results.title: ‘They basically got everything wrong’: A Russian diplomat speaks out on the war.
results.abstract: Boris Bondarev, a Russian official who resigned over the war in Ukraine, said his colleagues were focused more on pleasing their superiors than on delivering accurate information to Moscow.

media.caption: Boris Bondarev, right, at a United Nations meeting in Geneva this month.

results.adx_keywords: Police Reform;Police;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;United States Politics and Government;Executive Orders and Memorandums;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Justice Department
results.byline: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Charlie Savage
results.title: Biden Set to Issue Policing Order on Anniversary of Floyd Killing
results.abstract: The order would direct all federal agencies to revise their use-of-force policies and create a national registry of officers fired for misconduct.

media.caption: President Biden and Jill Biden, the first lady, at a ceremony in early May for law enforcement officers who died in the line of duty. The president is expected to sign a new executive order that creates a database of officers who have been fired due to misconduct.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times
